sentences.en: A Mercedes carries a certain cachet.
A perch at Goldman Sachs used to a certain cachet as well a private jet.
sentences.cn: 以前,在高盛(GoldmanSachs)担任要职,除了能享用私人飞机,还能获得一定的声望.

sentences.en: But the cachet of the top Valley brands only goes so far over here.
sentences.cn: 但这些硅谷著名风险投资品牌在中国并不是特别成功.

sentences.en: Dr. Manette was imprisoned through a lettre de cachet.
sentences.cn: 马奈特医生由逮捕密令被囚禁.

sentences.en: Federal courts have a certain cachet which state courts lack.
sentences.cn: 联邦法院有某种州法院所缺乏的特别的东西.

sentences.en: France's Champagne region, for instance, helps give Veuve Clicquot special cachet.
sentences.cn: 例如法国香槟区就给[凯歌皇牌]特别的尊贵象徵.

sentences.en: Her presence lends a certain cachet to the company.
sentences.cn: 她的出席能够给公司带来好名声.

sentences.en: In the world of jewelry, the Cartier name has long - standing cachet.
sentences.cn: 在珠宝世界里, 卡迪亚这个名字有着经久不衰的威望.

sentences.en: Rembrandt's paintings show the cachet of genius.
sentences.cn: 伦勃朗的绘画是天才的象徵.

words.tran_cn: （证明品质的）优良标志；公务印章；私人印戳；标记；威望；纪念邮戳

trans.tran_cn: 特征，威信，（显示优越的）标志，扁囊药剂
trans.tran_en: If someone or something has a certain cachet, they have a quality which makes people admire them or approve of them
